Helps in the creation of a TrailManager. Call the Apply() method to apply the changes.

Constructors

TrailManagerBuilder(CreatureComponents, Transform, float, float)

Helps in the creation of a TrailManager. Call the Apply() method to apply the changes.

public TrailManagerBuilder(CreatureComponents components, Transform rootSegment, float segmentSnapSpeed = 5, float maxSegmentOffset = -1)

Parameters

components CreatureComponents

The object that holds all creature components.

rootSegment Transform

The object that the TrailManager is added to. Is generally a part of the rig. This bone does NOT get animated, and should NOT be included in the list of trail bones.

segmentSnapSpeed float

Controls rigidity. The higher this value, the faster the TrailManager can revert to its default (stiff) state. The lower this value, the more "floaty" it appears.

maxSegmentOffset float

If -1 (default), there is no limit on how far each segment can go. Otherwise, this value forces each bone to remain within a certain distance of its starting point.

TrailManagerBuilder(Transform, BehaviourLOD, Transform, float, float)

Helps in the creation of a TrailManager. Call the Apply() method to apply the changes.

public TrailManagerBuilder(Transform creatureRoot, BehaviourLOD behaviourLOD, Transform rootSegment, float segmentSnapSpeed = 5, float maxSegmentOffset = -1)

Parameters

creatureRoot Transform

The root of the creature. Typically the object that holds the Creature component and all CreatureActions.

behaviourLOD BehaviourLOD

The BehaviourLOD of this creature.

rootSegment Transform

The object that the TrailManager is added to. Is generally a part of the rig. This bone does NOT get animated, and should NOT be included in the list of trail bones.

segmentSnapSpeed float

Controls rigidity. The higher this value, the faster the TrailManager can revert to its default (stiff) state. The lower this value, the more "floaty" it appears.

maxSegmentOffset float

If -1 (default), there is no limit on how far each segment can go. Otherwise, this value forces each bone to remain within a certain distance of its starting point.

Properties

AllowDisableOnScreen

If true, this TrailManager could be disabled while outside the BehaviourLOD's "close threshold" (for performance reasons). True by default.

public bool AllowDisableOnScreen { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

BehaviourLOD

The BehaviourLOD of this creature.

public BehaviourLOD BehaviourLOD { get; set; }

Property Value

BehaviourLOD

CreatureRoot

The root of the creature. Typically the object that holds the Creature component and all CreatureActions.

public Transform CreatureRoot { get; set; }

Property Value

Transform

MaxSegmentOffset

If -1 (default), there is no limit on how far each segment can go. Otherwise, this value forces each bone to remain within a certain distance of its starting point.

public float MaxSegmentOffset { get; set; }

Property Value

float

PitchMultiplier

Multiplier for the intensity of each bone's trail effect. The lowest time value (t=0) affects the first bone while the highest time value (t=1) affects the last bone. Default value is FlatMultiplierAnimationCurve.

public AnimationCurve PitchMultiplier { get; set; }

Property Value

AnimationCurve

RollMultiplier

Multiplier for the intensity of each bone's trail effect. The lowest time value (t=0) affects the first bone while the highest time value (t=1) affects the last bone. Default value is FlatMultiplierAnimationCurve.

public AnimationCurve RollMultiplier { get; set; }

Property Value

AnimationCurve

RootSegment

The object that the TrailManager is added to. Is generally a part of the rig. This bone does NOT get animated, and should NOT be included in the list of trail bones.

public Transform RootSegment { get; set; }

Property Value

Transform

SegmentSnapSpeed

Controls rigidity. The higher this value, the faster the TrailManager can revert to its default (stiff) state. The lower this value, the more "floaty" it appears.

public float SegmentSnapSpeed { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Trails

The array that contains all of the transforms of the affected bones.

public Transform[] Trails { get; set; }

Property Value

Transform[]

YawMultiplier

Multiplier for the intensity of each bone's trail effect. The lowest time value (t=0) affects the first bone while the highest time value (t=1) affects the last bone. Default value is FlatMultiplierAnimationCurve.

public AnimationCurve YawMultiplier { get; set; }

Property Value

AnimationCurve

Methods

Apply()

Finalizes creation of this TrailManager.

public TrailManager Apply()

Returns

TrailManager

SetAllMultiplierAnimationCurves(AnimationCurve)

Sets the multiplier in every direction to curve.

public void SetAllMultiplierAnimationCurves(AnimationCurve curve)

Parameters

curve AnimationCurve

SetTrailArrayToAllChildren()

Forces the Trails array to contain every single child of the RootSegment. Does not work well when the creature has fins or any sort of bone structure in the spine that isn't meant to be 100% animated.

public void SetTrailArrayToAllChildren()

SetTrailArrayToChildrenWithKeywords(string)

Fills the Trails array with every child of the RootSegment (recursive) that contains keyword in its name (case insensitive). Ordered from parent to child, top to bottom.

public void SetTrailArrayToChildrenWithKeywords(string keyword)

Parameters

keyword string

SetTrailArrayToPhysBoneChildren()

Fills the Trails array with every child (recursive) of the RootSegment that contains 'phys' in its name (case insensitive). Ordered from parent to child, top to bottom.

public void SetTrailArrayToPhysBoneChildren()
